info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 9:11PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern McPherson County through 1045 PM CDT... At 1011 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Greenway, or 8 miles northwest of Eureka, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern McPherson County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for north central South Dakota. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for north central South Dakota.
